title: Gareth Bale's Real Madrid future thrown into doubt again as he jets to London for talks with agent
text:
Gareth Bale flew to London to meet with his agent on Monday sparking more speculation that the Wales international remains unsettled in the Spanish capital.

Sportsmail understands the meeting was routine between the player and his long-term representative, Jonathan Barnett.

Real Madrid have said Bale had permission to make the trip and did train in the confines of the Valdebebas training ground on Monday morning before going to London.

Real Madrid's Gareth Bale was spotted travelling to London to meet his agent on Monday

🚨 EXCLUSIVA 🚨 Bale no entrena con el Madrid y viaja a Londres.



Todos los detalles a las 3 en #JUGONES. pic.twitter.com/XiT86AcJC3 — El Chiringuito TV (@elchiringuitotv) October 28, 2019

But the visit comes 48 hours before Madrid face Leganes in La Liga at home and appears to be another symptom of the on-going breakdown in relations between the club and the player.

Bale remains unhappy at the way he was treated in the summer when coach Zinedine Zidane said the sooner the player left the club the better it would be for everyone.

Some efforts have been made on the part of Zidane to make amends but Bale still feels that he was not giving the backing of, not just the coach, but also the club during pre-season transfer window.

At no point was he told that his contract until 2022, would be respected. And when his representative Barnett did set-up an exit from the club Real Madrid renegaded at the last minute because the transfer to Jiangsu Suning was for a nominal transfer fee of under 10m euros (£8.6m).

Sportsmail understands meeting was routine between Bale and Jonathan Barnett (pictured)

Having originally been skeptical about the switch Bale who has won four Champions Leagues at Real Madrid, had come around to the idea of becoming the biggest transfer to China in the history of the Chinese Super League.

Diario AS reported on Monday lunchtime that the club were now contemplating Bale leaving in January.

But the Bale camp are not optimistic that the Madrid board's stance of not allowing him go on a near-free transfer, just to get him off the wage bill, is about to change.

That would see Bale remain at the club, at least, until the end of the season but the player is understood to still be primarily focused on trying to get back to full fitness so he can help salvage Wales' qualification to Euro 2020.
description: Gareth Bale flew to London to meet with his agent on Monday sparking more speculation that the Wales international remains unsettled in the Spanish capital.
